Dear Ms. Knodel:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

lll. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/19/2024, Independent Living Youth (ILY 1) got medication
from another child. On the same day, staff member asked ILY 1
what staff he would have sex with if it were allowed. ILY 1 named
people and they began talking about anal sex. The staff member
explained how you should perform it from what she read, and ILY
1 responded with how he does it.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 12/27/24 and 1/7/25. Per
Staff 1, he reported he was in the staff office and was listening to
a conversation between ILY 1 and his assigned Independent
Living (IL) Specialist when he heard ILY 1 say he had taken
another youth’s medication. He said he became interested and
wanted to know how IL Specialist would respond as he was a new
staff and had just started the position and newly working with
independent living youths. He said IL Specialist told ILY 1 that he
was not in any trouble for taking the medication and then the
conversation shifted to anal sex. Staff 1 repeated the allegation
stated above. Staff 1 added that IL Specialist explained how she
would perform anal sex from what she read, and ILY 1 responded
how he would perform anal sex. Staff 1 reported he felt very
uncomfortable and felt that IL Specialist was supposed to be a
role model and not have this type of discussion with a youth. Staff
1 said he reported the information to the program manager and
was directed to write an incident report.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on 12/27/24, 1/2/25 and
2/24/24 via telephone and email. She provided contact
information for staff needed for the interviews for this allegation.
2

Independent Living Youth (ILY 1) was interviewed via phone
1/2/25. He reported he took one of ILY 2 medications in October
2024 because ILY 2 told him the pill is good for sleeping and he
wanted to sleep. He identified the pill as Trazadone and reported
he took it one time only. He refused to identify the name of ILY 2
that gave him the medication. ILY 1 said he did not have any side
effects other than sleeping after taking the pill.
ILY 1 reported he knew why the department wanted to speak with
him and that several people who work for the agency had already
talked to him about a conversation he had with IL Specialist who
no longer works for the agency. He reported he and IL Specialist
never had a sexual conversation. He reported IL Specialist and
one of her male coworkers (Staff 1) were in the office discussing
anal sex. He said as he walked past the office, he overheard IL
Specialist explaining to Staff 1 how anal sex is performed. ILY 1
reported IL Specialist was explaining to Staff 1 that if he engaged
in anal sex, he needed to use a condom or some type of lubricant
because the act itself was not natural and could be dangerous.
ILY 1 said he was interested in the conversation and when he
walked past the office he stopped and added his two cents. He
reported he said, “it doesn’t hurt, I was gonna “eat that” about a
celebrity crush that popped up on his phone.” He said IL
Specialist asked him who he would not do that with. He said he
did not answer and that was the end of the conversation.
ILY 1 again reported IL Specialist was having this conversation
with Staff 1 and not him. He said IL Specialist was very
professional with him, he wants to learn about sex because he
does not know much about it and that he trusts IL Specialist and
has learned a lot from talking to IL Specialist about life in general.
He added no additional information.
Independent Living Youth 2 (ILY 2) was interviewed on 1/2/25
via telephone. He was asked if he was involved in an incident
involving medication. He reported yes, he said prior, he had a
conversation with ILY 1 about sleeping and he could not
remember the day, he and ILY 1 had discussed ILY 1 not being
able to sleep at night. He told ILY 1 he had this medication that
when he takes it, he sleeps well. He said back in October 2024 he
was taking his medication and ILY 1 asked him if he could have
one of his pills because he could not sleep. ILY 2 said he gave
ILY 1 of his Trazodone because when he takes this medication,
he sleeps very well. He reported this was the only time he gave
ILY 1, one of his pills. He said he would never do it again. He said
he did not get into trouble but was informed to never do it again by
3

program staff. He said Foster Care Worker met with him regarding
the dangers of giving out his prescribed medication to other
individuals.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via phone on
1/2/25. She reported she was recently assigned to ILY 1 case.
She reported she entered the building and came into the office
and witnessed IL Specialist and Staff 1 having an inappropriate
conversation about anal sex in front of ILY 1. She recalled Staff 1
stating to IL Specialist that he did not understand the whole anal
sex thing and that he could not believe how much goes into anal
sex. FCW said when she entered the office, Staff 1 looked at her
and began to explain that IL Specialist was telling him how anal
sex was performed. FCW said she felt very uncomfortable and
confused because IL Specialist and Staff 1 had this inappropriate
conversation in front of ILY 1. FCW said IL Specialist and ILY 1
started talking about what staff they would have sex with. FCW
said she was bothered and left the office and that she was pretty
sure IL Specialist and Staff 1 knew she was upset. FCW reported
the staffing, and organization was in disarray during this time, and
she did not report the information to an administrator right away.
She said she found out from agency gossip the next day that IL
Specialist was suspended due to the sexual conversation she had
with ILY 1 and was under investigation by the agency. She said
she was informed by the supervisor that she was assigned ILY 1’s
case and to write a safety plan for ILY 1. She said she was later
interviewed by Quality Director on what she witnessed between IL
Specialist, Staff 1 and ILY 1. No additional information was
added.
IL Specialist was interviewed via phone on 2/24/25. Attempted
telephone calls were made on 1/2/25 and 1/27/25. No contact
was made. However, contact was made on 2/24/25. The
allegation mentioned above was discussed with IL Specialist
regarding a conversation with ILY 1 that was sexual in nature. IL
Specialist reported she was having a conversation with Staff 1
about anal sex in the office, and she was informing Staff 1 that he
needed to always practice safety precautions such as using a
condom and lubricants if he was going to engage in anal sex. She
reported ILY 1 was passing by the office and overheard the
conversation between her and Staff 1 and decided to involve
himself in the staff conversation. She said ILY 1 asked her what
staff in the building she would have sex with, and she told ILY 1
she would not answer that question. She said the conversation
was not a graphic conversation. She said the next day she was
informed she was suspended until further notice due to an
4

investigation as she was identified as one of the individuals
involved. She said all she wanted to do was advocate for safety.
She reported ILY 1 only heard part of the conversation she was
having with Staff 1. She said she believed that ILY 1 only heard
her explaining safety precautions to Staff 1 about anal sex.
IL Specialist reported she discussed ILY 1 taking another youth’s
medication and he would not tell her whose medication he took or
the youth’s name of where he received the medication from. She
said he did tell her the medication was taken over two months ago
and that he had no side effects. She reported she did not have
the appropriate training to be associated with the independent
living program and no one was training her in the agency. She
said when she was hired in, she was hired in as a foster care
specialist and then was transferred to independent living because
most of the staff and administrators had been terminated and the
administrators that were left were putting staff in different
programs to cover shifts. IL Specialist said everything about the
agency was disorganized. IL Specialist said she was never
informed by anyone of the status of her employment from the
agency. IL Specialist was provided the Human Resource
telephone number by this Consultant.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed on 2/24/25 via
telephone. PM reported Staff 1 approached him and shared a
conversation he overheard from ILY 1 and IL Specialist that was
sexual in nature and inappropriate. He reported he directed Staff
1 to write an incident report. He said he contacted Quality
Director. PM reported afterwards, he went on medical leave and
was away from the agency for a period of time.
Quality Director (QD) was interviewed on 2/24/25 via
telephone. She reported she interviewed ILY 1 about medication
he had taken that belongs to another youth. She said ILY 1 told
her that he did take the medication (1 pill) once from another
youth and the medication was for his mood to help him sleep. He
identified the medication as Trazadone. She said he would not
identify what youth gave him the medication. QD reported ILY 1
was informed that he should never take medication that was not
prescribed to him and how the medication could present multiple
dangers with his health. She said ILY 1 responded by saying he
would no longer do this. QD said she spoke with FCW and
informed her when ILY 1 has his next appointment with the
psychologist to discuss ILY 1 difficulty sleeping with the doctor.
5

QD reported she asked ILY 1 if he had witnessed or was involved
in inappropriate conversations with staff related to sex or sexual
acts. She said ILY 1 said Staff 1 and IL Specialist were in the
office talking about anal sex and he walked towards the door and
asked, what did he just walk into. QD said ILY 1 said IL Specialist
told ILY 1 that Staff 1 was asking her how anal sex works. QD
reported that ILY 1 said he joined the conversation and said it
doesn’t hurt and that he was going to “eat that” about a celebrity
that popped up on his phone. QD reported that ILY 1 said IL
Specialist asked ILY 1 who he would not do that with, ILY 1 said
he did not respond and that was the end of the conversation that
ILY 1 states he had with IL Specialist.
Document Review
• ILY 1 Case record. He is 17 years old and was placed with
Holy Cross IL program October 29, 2024. He is currently
not prescribed any medications.
• Incident Report dated 12/19/24, written by Staff 1 regarding
ILY 1 taking medication from ILY 2 and having an
inappropriate sexual conversation with IL Specialist. The
incident report states, “The client stated that he had gotten
a pill from another peer but didn’t know what it was called.
While in the office with IL Specialist which is the case
manager of ILY 1. Also, had an inappropriate sexual
behavior conversation. The writer spoke with Program
Manager, and he reported the incident to DHHS.”
• Safety Plan General for ILY dated 12/27/24, written by
FCW. The plan consists of safety concerns of taking
medication from other individuals and inappropriate
conversation with staff. The plan included ILY 1’s triggers,
positive coping skills, lack of sleep and respecting
professional boundaries and FCW making a doctor’s
appointment for ILY 1 to discuss his lack of sleeping.
• ILY 2 case record. He is 18 years old and was placed with
Holy Cross IL program October 1, 2024. He is prescribed 3
psychotropic medications, one is Trazodone 150 MG.
• IL Specialist personnel record. She worked for the agency
from 6/17/24 – 1/10/25. She received a memo of
conversation (Performance) dated 12/9/2024, for missing a
court hearing, and submitting two late Updated Service
Plans. IL Specialist has a bachelor’s degree in psychology,
worked in other residential settings with youth and attended
DHHS CTWI training.
• Quality Director report conclusion that started 12/30/24 and
ended 1/9/25. Report concluded IL Specialist did have
inappropriate sexual conversation with ILY 1.
6

• Human Resource letter dated 12/23/2024, from the Human
Resource Director informing IL Specialist that she is placed
on administrative suspension pending the outcome of an
internal investigation. The suspension will be unpaid.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as IL Specialist and Staff 1
was having an inappropriate sexual conversation in the staff office
and ILY 1 joined the conversation. Foster Care Worker witnessed
the inappropriate conversation that occurred between ILY 1 and IL
Specialist. ILY 1 said IL Specialist asked him an inappropriate
question and he did not answer the question. Staff nor youth
denied that an inappropriate conversation occurred in the staff
office. The Quality Director report concluded that IL Specialist did
have an inappropriate sexual conversation with ILY 1.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan,
continuation of the agency current license status is recommended.
